title: Software Architecture
summary: Modern software architecture principles and patterns
description: A comprehensive overview of software architecture covering design patterns, scalability, security, and best practices for building robust applications.

children.title: Design Patterns
children.description: Reusable solutions to commonly occurring problems in software design and architecture.

children.title: Creational Patterns
children.description: Design patterns that deal with object creation mechanisms, trying to create objects in a manner suitable to the situation.

children.title: Singleton
children.summary: Ensure a class has only one instance
children.description: Ensures a class has only one instance and provides a global point of access to it.

children.title: Factory Method
children.summary: Create objects without specifying exact classes
children.description: Creates objects without specifying the exact class of object that will be created.

children.title: Structural Patterns
children.description: Design patterns that ease the design by identifying a simple way to realize relationships between entities.

children.title: Adapter
children.summary: Allow incompatible interfaces to work together
children.description: Allows objects with incompatible interfaces to collaborate.

children.title: Decorator
children.description: Allows behavior to be added to an individual object, dynamically, without affecting the behavior of other objects from the same class.

children.title: Scalability
children.description: Principles and techniques for building systems that can handle increased load and growth.

children.title: Horizontal Scaling
children.description: Scaling by adding more servers to the pool of resources to handle increased load.

children.title: Vertical Scaling
children.description: Scaling by adding more power (CPU, RAM) to existing servers.

children.title: Load Balancing
children.description: Technique to distribute incoming network traffic across multiple servers to ensure no single server bears too much demand.

children.title: Security
children.description: Essential security principles and practices for building secure applications.

children.title: Authentication
children.description: Process of verifying the identity of a user or system.

children.title: Authorization
children.description: Process of determining whether a user has permission to access a specific resource.

children.title: Encryption
children.description: Process of converting information or data into a code to prevent unauthorized access.
